subject: Re: [junit] New poll for junit
msgSnippet: And a co-worker of mine just purchased 10.4 this week and upgraded his PowerBook and he said it configured 1.5 as the CurrentSDK.  It still had 1.4, though.
messageBody:
And a co-worker of mine just purchased 10.4 this week and upgraded
his PowerBook and he said it configured 1.5 as the CurrentSDK. It
still had 1.4, though.

On Jan 19, 2006, at 4:42 PM, Gregory S. Hill wrote:

> Simon,
>
> JDK 1.5 is available on the apple website:
>
> https://connect.apple.com/cgi-bin/WebObjects/MemberSite.woa/201/wo/
> jJ1v9to6uhmj2XkccT2ItpcMcpR/4.1.17.2.1.3.3.1.1.1.1.3.7.3.3.1
>
> It's labelled as "J2SE 5.0 Release 4 Developer Preview 4".
>
> -greg
>
> On Jan 19, 2006, at 4:36 PM, Simon Chappell wrote:
>
>> And we have a corporate standard of 1.4.1 at this time. I haven't
>> even
>> begun to think about using 1.5 yet. Who knows when corporate will
>> decide we can update and I think that the Mac (my primary personal
>> platform) is still using 1.4.2, even under OS X 10.4. Which is a big
>> reason why I haven't upgraded past OS X 10.3 yet. :-(
>>
>> Simon
>>

--
Daryl

"We want great men who, when fortune frowns, will not be discouraged."
-- Colonel Henry Knox, 1776
